From: <Torsten.MuellerX@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Monday, December 16, 2002 4:10 AM
Subject: [junit] EXCEPTION_FLT_UNDERFLOW with JUnit and JNI


> Hello,
>
> everytime I try to run a unit test doing some JNI calls
> I run into the following exception. The -noloading option
> seems to have no impact.
>
> Has anybody else also experienced this kind of error?
> If yes - any hints are greatly appreciated.

It seems like the promblem is only to do with JNI calls.  A few points worth
checking, if you haven't done it yet.

1)  Make sure all the functions in the native code are properly exported.
2)  The function names and parameters in native code are matched with their
Java peers.
3)  The function pointers from dll are REALLY pointing to the correct
address.

> We use JDK 1.4.1_01 with JUnit 3.8.1.
>
> Torsten Mueller
> e-Mail: Torsten.MuellerX@...
>
>
